New Records: The Philadelphia Phillies had a 34-game winning streak, the second-longest in MLB history.
The Milwaukee Brewers clinched the NL Central title earlier in the day.
Key Match Events: The Philadelphia Phillies suffered a 2-1 walk-off loss to the Milwaukee Brewers.
The Brewers' victory kept their magic number at 2 for the NL's second seed.
Pre-Game Insights: The Brewers were motivated to win as they were trying to secure a first-round bye in the NL Division Series.
Phillies manager Rob Thomson emphasized the need for the team to improve their two-strike approach.
Post-Match Reflections: The Brewers celebrated their victory with beer and champagne.
Phillies players and manager Rob Thomson reflected on the team's performance and future strategies.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies' 16 consecutive strikeouts in two games highlighted their offensive struggles.
The Brewers' win kept their playoff momentum, potentially leading to a first-round bye.
